abstract: The digraphs P(n,k) have vertices corresponding to length k permutations of an n set and arcs corresponding to (k+1) permutations. Answering a question of A. G. Starling et al. [Congr. Numerantium 162, 129–137 (2003; Zbl 1056.05088)] we show that these digraphs are Hamiltonian for k≤n-3. We do this using restricted Eulerian cycles and the fact that P(n,k) is nearly the line digraph of P(n,k-1). We also show that the digraphs P(n,n-2) are not Hamiltonian for n≥4 using a result of R. A. Rankin [Proc. Camb. Philos. Soc. 44, 17–25 (1948; Zbl 0030.10606)] on Cayley digraphs.
